text: Hans "Hasse" Selander (born 15 March 1945) is a former Swedish footballer. Hans played for Helsingborgs IF in Allsvenskan 1962–1968. Then he played for the minor club Upsala IF because of university studies. He then played for IK Sirius FK. In 1973–74 he played one season in the German Regionalliga with VfR Wormatia 08 Worms. After that Selander did great work with Halmstads BK and won Allsvenskan in 1976 and 1979. He retired in 1981. Hans was capped 42 times for the Sweden national football team and scored 3 goals (1966–1977). He was also a member of the team in the 1970 FIFA World Cup where he participated in two games. ==References== ==External links== *Profile * Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:Swedish footballers Category:Sweden international footballers Category:1970 FIFA World Cup players Category:Helsingborgs IF players Category:Halmstads BK players Category:Expatriate footballers in Germany Category:Swedish football managers Category:Falkenbergs FF managers Category:IK Sirius Fotboll players Category:Association football defenders
title: Hans Selander
